> Why don't you like keeping your tests in the same package scope, 
> but (optionally) in a physically separate directory ?  That's what we
> do.  That's what I see most projects I've worked with do.

Someone else pointed this technique out as well - I hadn't really thought
about doing it this way - I had been mirroring the heirarchy but prepending
"test." onto the package names.  I'll try it the way that's been suggested
and see how it works in practice.  One immediate issue that I see is I'll
have to do something in my "jar" targets in ant to keep test code from
being automatically inserted into my jar files.  It's probably as simple as
using separate output directories for test code and normal source code.

Thanks for the tip!

Take care,
	Dale
